CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a disciplinary complaint against Judge PERSON of LOC with ORG , accusing the latter of various violations of procedural law , including the failure to ensure the attendance of a party at the hearing on DATE .

“ Judge PERSON has violated LAW ... as he did not serve the legal claim and the supporting documentation to PERSON .

“ CARDINAL . [ The following categories of persons ] are exempted from the payment of court fees :
c ) applicants in applications [ in respect of damage ] caused by a crime ... ”
“ CARDINAL . A final judgment may be declared null and void following a request of a concerned party if : ...
b ) CARDINAL of the parties or DATE if the party needed legal representation – their representative was not summonsed to the hearing .

CARDINAL . An application to declare a final judgment null and void based on these grounds is inadmissible if the party could have presented them during the hearing at the courts of first instance , appeal , or cassation . ”
“ CARDINAL . A final decision may be subject to a reopening application based on newly discovered circumstances if :
a ) it transpires that the document on which the decision was based had been fabricated ; ...

“ CARDINAL . An application to declare a decision null and void ... must be lodged within DATE ... [ T]he renewal of this time - limit is not permitted .
CARDINAL . The time - limit starts to run from DATE on which a party becomes aware of the grounds for declaring a decision null and void ...

CARDINAL . If an application to declare a decision null and void is based on LAW CARDINAL ( b ) , the time - limit starts to run when a party , or if the latter is legally incapable , their legal representative is informed of the decision . ... ”

CARDINAL . Under Articles CARDINAL - CARDINAL of LAW , an interlocutory appeal could be lodged regarding different types of decisions defined in the LAW . Among others , LAW provided for the lodging of such an appeal against an immediate enforcement of a judgment . Under LAW of the LAW a party could lodge an interlocutory appeal against a court ’s refusal to reinstate statutory time - limits for appeal . LAW CCP ) ( DATE ) provided for a party ’s right to lodge an interlocutory appeal against a court ’s decision concerning the termination of a preliminary investigation .
